scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-54 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-54 is a star with 0.51 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.5 times its radius. It is located 886.17 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 13.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-54 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-54 system


Kepler-54 b

Kepler-54 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2013-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-54 b is 292.560 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-54 b is 2.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-54 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


Kepler-54 c

Kepler-54 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2013-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-54 c is 117.660 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-54 c is 1.230 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-54 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


Kepler-54 d

Kepler-54 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-54 d is 2.957 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-54 d is 1.530 that of Earth. At 2.957 Earth masses, Kepler-54 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system Kepler-54, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-54 - System With 3 Exoplanets
